hotspots.label: Compound Eyes
hotspots.fact: Bees have huge compound eyes made of thousands of tiny lenses that work together. This helps them see flowers and navigate through the air super fast!

hotspots.label: Wings
hotspots.fact: A bee's wings beat about 200 times per second, which creates the buzzing sound we hear. These powerful wings help bees carry pollen back to their hive.

hotspots.label: Pollen Baskets
hotspots.fact: Bees have special pouches on their back legs called pollen baskets where they collect and carry pollen. This yellow dust helps flowers make seeds and new plants!

hotspots.label: Fuzzy Body
hotspots.fact: A bee's fuzzy hair is perfect for picking up pollen grains as it visits flowers. The hair on their body acts like nature's velcro for collecting pollen!
